com.amitinside.featureflags

Interface FeatureService


  • @ProviderType
public interface FeatureService
    The FeatureService service is the applications access point to the Feature Flag functionality. It can be used to query the available features.
    See Also:
    Feature, FeatureGroup, ActivationStrategy

    • Method Summary

      • getFeatures

        Stream<Feature> getFeatures()
        Retrieve all (known) Features.

        Features are known if they are registered as Feature services or are configured with OSGi configuration whose factory PID is com.amitinside.featureflags.feature.

        Returns:
        The known Features

      • getFeature

        Optional<Feature> getFeature(String name)
        Returns the feature with the given name.

        Features are known if they are registered as Feature services or are configured with OSGi configuration whose factory PID is com.amitinside.featureflags.feature.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the feature.
        Returns:
        The feature wrapped in Optional or empty Optional instance if not known or the name is an empty string or null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null

        Removes a feature.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the named feature is known and removed by this operation. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature is not known or the operation failed to remove the feature
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null

      • isFeatureEnabled

        boolean isFeatureEnabled(String name)
        Returns true if a feature with the given name is known and enabled under the feature associated strategy. The feature can belong to a feature group and the groups can also specify its enablement. In this case, the feature groups enablement configuration will be considered as the belonging feature's configuration.

        Features are known if they are registered as Feature services or are configured with OSGi configuration whose factory PID is com.amitinside.featureflags.feature.

        If a feature belongs to a feature group, the feature groups configuration would be considered as the feature's configuration. If not, the activation or the enablement would be validated against a valid activation strategy if specified, otherwise the explicitly declared enabled flag in the feature would be used.

        If a feature belongs to multiple groups, then the enablement would be determined by the active group. If there are multiple groups enabled, then the feature would by default be enabled.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the feature to check for enablement.
        Returns:
        true if the named feature is known and enabled. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature is not known.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null
        See Also:
        Control flow for the determination of feature enablement

      • isGroupEnabled

        boolean isGroupEnabled(String name)
        Returns true if a feature group with the given name is known and enabled under the associated strategy.

        Feature Groups are known if they are registered as FeatureGroup services or are configured with OSGi configuration whose factory PID is com.amitinside.featureflags.feature.group.

        The activation or the enablement of a feature group would be validated against a valid activation strategy if specified, otherwise he explicitly declared enabled flag in the feature group would be used.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the feature group to check for enablement.
        Returns:
        true if the named feature group is known and enabled. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature group is not known.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null
        See Also:
        Control flow for the determination of feature enablement

      • enableFeature

        boolean enableFeature(String name)
        Changes the specified feature's enabled property to true.

        If the feature belongs to a feature group, enabling the feature explicitly would not be taken into consideration as its enablement solely depends on the feature group. Likewise, if the feature doesn't belong to a feature goupd rather it associates a strategy, its enablements would be solely dependent on the associated strategy.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the feature
        Returns:
        true if the named feature is known and the operation succeeded. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature is not known or the operation is unsuccessful
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null
        See Also:
        Control flow for the determination of feature enablement

      • disableFeature

        boolean disableFeature(String name)
        Changes the specified feature's enabled property to false.

        If the feature belongs to a feature group, enabling the feature explicitly would not be taken into consideration as its enablement solely depends on the feature group. Likewise, if the feature doesn't belong to a feature group rather it associates a strategy, its enablement would be solely dependent on the associated strategy.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the feature
        Returns:
        true if the named feature is known and the operation succeeded. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature is not known or the operation is unsuccessful
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null
        See Also:
        Control flow for the determination of feature enablement

      • enableGroup

        boolean enableGroup(String name)
        Changes the specified feature group's enabled property to true.

        If the feature group associates a strategy, its enablement would be solely dependent on the associated strategy.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the feature group
        Returns:
        true if the named feature is known and the operation succeeded. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature is not known or the operation is unsuccessful
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null
        See Also:
        Control flow for the determination of feature enablement

      • disableGroup

        boolean disableGroup(String name)
        Changes the specified feature group's enabled property to false.

        If the feature group associates a strategy, its enablement would be solely dependent on the associated strategy.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the feature group
        Returns:
        true if the named feature group is known and the operation succeeded. Specifically false is also returned if the named feature group is not known or the operation is unsuccessful
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument name is null
        See Also:
        Control flow for the determination of feature enablement
